accessibility.header: Accessibility statement Get help with your online immigration account
accessibility.intro: This accessibility statement applies to all parts of the help form completed through the domain
accessibility.intro-p1: This website is run by the Home Office. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. For example, that means you should be able to:
accessibility.intro-p1-li1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
accessibility.intro-p1-li2: zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
accessibility.intro-p1-li3: navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
accessibility.intro-p1-li4: listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of NVDA and VoiceOver)
accessibility.intro-p2: We have also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
accessibility.intro-p3-post-link: has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
accessibility.how-accessible-p1: We know some parts of this website are not fully accessible. You can see a full list of any issues we currently know about in the Non-accessible content section of this statement.
accessibility.feedback-p1-pre-link: If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read, audio recording or braille email
accessibility.feedback-p2: We will consider your request and get back to you in 30 days.
accessibility.feedback-p3-post-link: with completing your online Home Office application.
accessibility.reporting-header: Reporting accessibility problems with this website
accessibility.reporting-p1-pre-link: We are always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we are not meeting accessibility requirements, you can report this at
accessibility.reporting-p2-link: Read tips on contacting organisations about inaccessible websites.
accessibility.enforcement-p1-pre-link: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations'). If you are not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
accessibility.enforcement-p1-link: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)
accessibility.enforcement-p2-pre-link: If you are in Northern Ireland and are not happy with how we respond to your complaint you can contact the
accessibility.enforcement-p2-post-link: who are responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018(the 'accessibility regulations') in Northern Ireland.
accessibility.technical-info-header: Technical information about this website's accessibility
accessibility.technical-info-p1: The Home Office is committed to making its website accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
accessibility.compliance-p1-pre-link: This website is partially compliant with the
accessibility.compliance-p1-post-link: AA standard, due to the non-compliances listed below.
accessibility.non-accessible-p1: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
accessibility.non-compliance-li1-text:
The example of a unique application number (UAN) used in the service includes hyphens. These hyphens are not read by all screen readers. This might make it difficult for some users to enter their UAN in the correct format. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion 3.3.2 (labels and instructions).
We plan to fix this by July 2021.
accessibility.non-compliance-warning: We may discover more non-compliant content in future testing. We have not yet tested with JAWS or speech to text software. Additional testing is needed with NVDA.
accessibility.disproportionate-burden-p1: At this time, we have not made any disproportionate burden claims.
accessibility.outside-scope-header: Content that is not within the scope of the accessibility regulations
accessibility.outside-scope-p1: At this time, we have not identified any content that is not within scope of the accessibility regulations.
accessibility.preparation-p1: This statement was prepared on 7 January 2021. It was last reviewed on 7 January 2021.
accessibility.preparation-p2: This website was last tested on 16 December 2020. Testing was carried out internally by the Home Office.
accessibility.preparation-p3: We tested the service based on a user's ability to complete key journeys. All parts of the chosen journeys were tested.
